DataElement.preferredName: Person Prior Chimeric Antigen Receptor T-Cell Therapy Persistent Disease CD19 Positive Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that are related to prior treatment of Chimeric Antigen Receptor T cells and persistent CD19 expression as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Prior Chimeric Antigen Receptor T-Cell Therapy Persistent Disease CD19 Positive Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._Earlier in time or order._A type of treatment in which a patient's T cells (a type of immune system cell) are changed in the laboratory so they will attack cancer cells. T cells are taken from a patient's blood. Then the gene for a special receptor that binds to a certain protein on the patient's cancer cells is added in the laboratory. The special receptor is called a chimeric antigen receptor (CAR). Large numbers of the CAR T cells are grown in the laboratory and given to the patient by infusion. Chimeric antigen receptor T-cell therapy is being studied in the treatment of some types of cancer._A disease that does not go to remission despite treatment._Indicates that CD19 expression has been detected in a sample._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Person Prior Chimeric Antigen Receptor T-Cell Therapy
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A human being.:Earlier in time or order.:A type of treatment in which a patient's T cells (a type of immune system cell) are changed in the laboratory so they will attack cancer cells. T cells are taken from a patient's blood. Then the gene for a special receptor that binds to a certain protein on the patient's cancer cells is added in the laboratory. The special receptor is called a chimeric antigen receptor (CAR). Large numbers of the CAR T cells are grown in the laboratory and given to the patient by infusion. Chimeric antigen receptor T-cell therapy is being studied in the treatment of some types of cancer.

Concepts.definition: Treatment that uses T-cells that have been engineered to contain a chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) that specifically targets a particular antigen.

Property.preferredName: Persistent Disease CD19 Positive Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A disease that does not go to remission despite treatment.:Indicates that CD19 expression has been detected in a sample.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A disease that does not go to remission despite treatment.
Indicates that CD19 expression has been detected in a sample.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has been treated w
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has been treated with chimeric antigen receptor (CAR)-modified T cells targeting CD19 in the past, do they have persistent CD19 expression on leukemia cells?
